reviewText: My workout regimen is an extensive collection of fitness dvds.  If I feel my motivation waning, I'll buy one or two new ones so I wound up with quite a rotation of a library of workout dvds. Because of this, I'm picky about which ones I like, which ones I keep, and I have quite a comparison.Instruction: That said, this one ROCKS!! He is charming and fun personality-wise with some of the best instruction I've seen out there in doing the moves right.  But don't think this is a beginner's dvd because of the great instruction, while you can alter the workout easily to fit your level, even those who love to workout will FEEL it.Caloric Burn: Body By Jake takes to heart the evidence that the most effective workout will get your heart rate up then do strength training while it's up and alternate this fat burning and muscle building circuit through the workout.  I wear a bodybugg to measure my daily caloric burn so I can actually SEE scientifically how many calories a workout I do burns and how many calories I burn per minute doing it...and this was a scorcher!!  However, the moves really worked my muscles well too which means, with strength training, you continue to burn calories long after the workout is done in addition to the cardio he has which burns them fast during the workout.Cueing: His cueing is beyond reproach and extremely easy to follow...no need to hit "rewind" on this one or get tripped up and frustrated. He acts as a personal trainer in the dvd so his instruction is constant and fluid and engaging.Music: The music is nothing special but it's not irritating either...typical fitness dvd music.Negative: the dvd shows the participants using a weight bench for leaning in some of the exercises which is not something everyone has in their home gym or livingroom. However, the moves he does on these are the exact ones other dvds do by simply standing up and leaning over so don't feel you have to have one.  It's easily altered...when he put one knee on the bench and leaned over and then did arm exercises, I simply leaned over standing doing the same ones which is what I was already taught to do. But any couch or chair would work too if you didnt want to stand and lean which is equally as effective.Set: love the set...very different. Looks like a livingroom of a modern mansion with pool through the windows, great art, sculptures etc. My kinda place to workout!!Great idea: Rather than everyone constantly counting during the dvd or him stopping to say how many more reps you need to do, there is simply a count down timer on the screen. This way all he has to talk about is instruction and cueing and you know right where you are and how many reps you have left. Brilliant!! Why doesn't everyone do this?? It allows him to concentrate on instruction and cueing which is what the viewer really benefits from...not stopping and counting or keeping track of counting in their head...that is all freed up for making the workout flow with a personal trainer telling you the most helpful info. I like this a lot.Conclusion: This workout is TOPS in my favorites. It's effective beyond reproach, burns off the fat, builds the muscle and the instruction is excellent and everyone doing it should learn something about form, no matter how long you've been working out. Great for both men and women in my opinion. You'll feel it and it'll work. Very happy with this dvd purchase! I'd easily buy more of his workouts. If you are a beginner, don't be intimidated...he'll tell you that you can do some of the exercises without holding weights whereas those who are more advanced can get more intensity by holding weights and there's nothing to trip you up here.
summary: great calorie burner, great muscle toner, great instructor and cueing...what more can I say?
Title: N/A

reviewText: While the production values and "entertainment" level of this series can't compete with more recent DVDs, Body by Jake is a very effective, no-nonsense approach to fitness. The routines are explained very well so you can ensure you're maintaining proper form. Lots of strength routines, but also a good amount of cardio. You'll need weights and a bench (although the latter is not essential).The programs were originally released over a decade ago on video tape, and it looks like they were just ported over to DVD without any enhancement (the DVD contains all three programs that were released separately on tape -- great value!). It looks OK, but even upscaled, the quality is only so-so. This does not, however, detract from using it, but it does give it more of a dated look.I love the count-down timer -- in the corner of the screen there's a stopwatch that tells you how much time is left in each routine. Very helpful and also a good motivator -- just when you are about to give up, you can see there's just a few seconds left, and push through to the end.The narration is rather cheesy at times, but you can always kill the sound once you learn the routines and play some music instead. The stopwatch will keep you on track even if the sound is off.A blast from the past to be sure, but effective exercise is timeless. This DVD will give you a very good workout using effective, well-rounded routines.
summary: Old school, but effective and a great value

reviewText: This DVD is one of the top three videos/DVDs in my HUGE collection.  It should be much better promoted than it is.I've been working out for 20 years, and have had three pregnancies, and am now in the best shape of my life, am strong, hardy, defined, tight and slim, even after extensive bladder surgery and an hysterectomy in late 2005.  This January, 2006, marks the first time I have ever even seen a "Body By Jake" video.  I am VERY impressed, as this DVD is thorough, organized, the cueing is excellent, the motivation is strong, and the techniques taught are rock-solid.  And although this DVD is derived from three videos from a series that is over ten years old (I thought I'd get that out of the way), it does not matter one bit, even if you are picky about costumes and music (like me). Jake is an EXCELLENT, vastly professional instructor/trainer/motivator.  Set looks new, participants are strong, music is fine-really!). He encourages you to work hard, instilling in you the confidence, mental and physical strength, and even humor (yes, humor) it takes to work out diligently every day. Who cares that Jake does infomercials promoting his fitness gadgets?  Maybe they're good gadgets.  BUT again--his videos are excellent--at least the three that are in this DVD, which consists of: Total Body Workout (45 minutes divided into three 15-minute workouts, or circuits.); Lower Body Workout (a total of three 20-min. circuits, or workouts); and Awesome Abba-Dabbas Workout (a 30 minute long video that is divided into two 15 minute workouts, or circuits).  Buy this DVD.  Use it.  Listen well, and learn even more than you think you already know.  You will sweat, and you will actually enjoy doing so, because you will know you've done one of the best workouts of your life, whichever one you choose to cue up on any given day.  I like to do the Total Body on M/W/F, the Lower Body on T/Th/Sat, and I tack on one of the Abbas to each throughout the week.  Or I alternate this DVD with a Kathy Smith Lift Weights to Lose Weight or a Yoga Zone DVD, or something else. And I take Sundays off.  BUY this DVD!  You'll be glad you did.-PS : You'll need dumbbells (at least three different weights, and if you are a beginner, start with none or with 1#, 3# and 5#), a firm-backed chair or workout bench, and a broomstick.
summary: A Thorough, Comprehensive Workout Series in One DVD
